11113.title: Other

111132.content:
Looking back on it all later, those that knew Naruto best as a child decided that they should have known better. After all, not a day went by (that the poor kid had the money) that Naruto wasn't sitting in 'his' stool at Ichiraku Ramen, eating his own weight in noodles....that never seemed to go anywhere. Seriously, the kid wasn't burning enough calories, he never gained weight, and he was - by every medical standard - a shrimp. Short and skinny for his age, with clothing purchased with 'growing room' out of his small orphan stipend regularly billowing off of his arms and legs. It wasn't until some time after his graduation that anyone had even the slightest inkling what was going on, or why.

Well, anyone except Kyuubi.

Behind the seal in Naruto's navel, rested an entire constructed dimension. Built outside of space and time by Naruto's father, an arguable genius of the sealing arts, it housed the dreaded Kyuubi no Yoko, the Nine-Tailed demon fox, who's tails caused tsunamis, who's steps caused earthquakes. Who, with a casual shoulder-check, might send the Hokage Monument crumbling into dust.

Not so much anymore; for the fox had been brought low near a hundred years past, his outward majesty reduced to the frail, tiny vessels in which he was sealed. First a woman, then a girl, and finally a baby. That tiny cage was the last straw.

Now, carefully meditating to float on a veritable ocean of ramen, which he had collected through years and years of transporting food and nutrient's from his host's stomach, the Kyuubi stretched forth his own energies, snaking them carefully - so very carefully - past the seal. He'd worked out long ago that the seals were meant to keep his energy within the bodies of his hosts, and to prevent him from doing them harm.

Well, his plans for Naruto were not exactly conventional, but you couldn't call it 'harm'. More of a boost, really. And he'd felt too cramped in tiny human bodies for far too long. He wanted room to spread his energy. He wanted the world to see, if not him, something to properly show his majesty once more. The red-tinged soup on which he sat started to swirl, carried outward as his chakra, for the first time, was drawn by his host's anger and pain.

Kyuubi grinned, showing far too many teeth, and pushed.

Time to renovate.
111132.title: Kyuubi's Chakra

choices: Hurry, Kyuubi, they're on to you!
Finding a toga is a priority
1111321.content:
Naruto blinked, shaking himself awake. He was on his back, on a cold stone floor. Where was he? What had happened?

"Awake, kid?"

Kakashi-sensei! Naruto remembered, they were in a fight on the bridge, and Sasuke, Sasuke! -

"Whoa, calm down. Fight's over, Naruto. Everyone's fine."

Naruto felt his teacher's hand grip his shoulder, and slowly relaxed. His eyes stung, and he couldn't help sniffling a bit. Shrugging off his teacher's hand, Naruto scrambled to his feet and stumbled his way over to a pile of slowly-melting ice. Frantic, he looked around for the body. Where was Sasuke's body?!

"Tch. Dobe."

Naruto froze, turning slowly with wide eyes, to see his...rival? Friend?....whatever, too confusing. Sasuke was there, and he was alive! The pale, dark-haired boy shot Naruto an almost friendly smirk. Naruto felt something bubbling up inside; he just couldn't hold it in!

"YATTA!" He cheered, and rushed over to his team-mate, lifting him up in the air and spinning him around.

"Oi!"

Naruto looked up, seeing the friend in his arms blushing and glaring down at him.

"Put me down, moron!" Sasuke snapped.

Laughing a bit, embarrassed, Naruto lowered Sasuke down to his feet.

Both teens froze. Sasuke's head only made it up to Naruto's nose.

"Mah, I was wondering when you'd notice. I thought the breeze would do it." Kakashi muttered as he strolled up.

Naruto blinked, and looked down. Sure enough, there was a large gap between his jacket and his pants, and his pants were definitely too short. He was also barefoot, though the rough ground didn't seem to be hurting him. Naruto looked up (a little) at his teacher, confused.

"Um...sensei? Why am I bigger?"

Kakashi shrugged, though if Naruto didn't know any better he'd think his teacher looked a bit worried. At this point, a grimy but serious-looking Sakura joined up with the group, looking Naruto up and down with confusion.

"That started when you...when you let out that red chakra of yours." Kakashi answered. Naruto's two younger team-mates nodded.

"You sort of...puffed up," Sakura tried, gesturing with her hands. "It was really strange. You started punching those ice mirrors, and they just exploded! After the fight, you passed out, but didn't...un-puff? Is that a word?"

"No," Kakashi said calmly. "No it is not. But that sums it up. The important thing is that we head back to the village as fast as possible."

Naruto frowned. "Okay...but why? I mean, I don't really mind being a little bigger, so why don't we go back to Tazuna's and reuuuuuuuuurp!"

Naruto slapped his hands over his mouth, blushing furiously. For some weird reason, he tasted ramen.

"That's why." Kakashi answered.

Naruto opened his mouth to get a better explanation, but suddenly he felt something.

It started as a feeling of almost painful fullness in his gut, and it pushed out. He could feel a burning energy pumping its way from his middle out to the tips of his fingers and toes. He shivered, and felt a pounding in his veins like his heart was forcing blood into every nook and cranny of his body.

"What...what's going on?" He rasped, clutching his chest.

"You'll have to describe it later." Kakashi said seriously.

Thump....Thump....Thump....Thump....

Naruto felt a strange, tight sensation in his skin; he wriggled a bit to try and make it go away. His muscles felt cramped; there was a strange soreness in his bones.

Boom

Looking back on it later, Naruto would describe that final, powerful pressure as if you were drinking from a hose and some jerk opened it up from window-garden to fire-hydrant.

Naruto heard and felt his body rumble strangely as his team-mates seemed to shrink. His black undershirt stretched as it pulled up along his stomach, leaving his middle completely exposed. His jacket crept up his arms and opened at the front, his pant-legs pulled tight against his calves, and he felt the ground sliding under the soles of his feet.

In just a few short moments, Naruto found himself looking Kakashi in the eye.
.
1111321.title: One Big Brat

choices: An uneventful trip home leads to a very informative examination.
Before they can reach the village...an ambush!
11113212.content:
The room was deadly silent as everyone stared at Naruto...even Naruto was staring at himself, shakily raising his arms up and turning his hands back and forth, blinking slowly. It felt so...weird, so alien! He still felt like himself, mostly but there was an increased heft to his form, a weight that hadn't existed just a few seconds prior. It made him feel like a stranger in his own skin. He carefully took up a bit of said skin in his fingers and pinched, hard. "Yeowch!"

His voice, still boyish and immature but with an added volume and slightly more depth due to his expanded chest, broke the spell that was in the room. Kakashi sighed and, feigning a casual attitude, calmly announced, "Well that was certainly strange."

"STRANGE?!" Sakura shouted, turning to face her sensei. "A herd of stray cats following you home is strange, this is downright unnatural! I know a thing or two about anatomy, sensei, and I know people don't just grow like that for no reason!"

"Calm down Sakura." Kakashi said, his eye glancing over to Naruto and Sasuke; Naruto was still running his hands over his exposed body, touching his flat stomach before bending over and rubbing his shins....tearing open the back of his pants in the process. He swiftly stood back up, blushing again, his bigger hands covering the prominent rip, hiding his boxers from view. Sasuke smirked, earning him a glare from the now much taller genin. "Panicking isn't going to help anyone. As I said earlier we should make our way back to the village as soon as possible. Before we go, Naruto, I need to ask you a few questions."

Naruto shuffled his way over to Kakashi, looking a bit sullen as his hands were still covering his backside. "W-What is it Kakashi-sensei?"

"First of all, how do you feel?"

Naruto opened his mouth to respond but quickly closed it again, his teeth clicking together audibly as he gritted them slightly, thinking it over. How DID he feel? He still hadn't really processed what had just happened! Not to mention the tightness of his clothes was starting to irritate him. It was like he had decided to dress himself up in his little kid clothes, hardly a dignified look for a proud ninja. On the other hand...he didn't feel sick, he didn't feel tired, hell, he didn't even feel worn out! It was like he hadn't just been in a grueling life or death fight not half an hour ago. He had been able to lift Sasuke up off his feet by barely trying, as well. He had always considered himself strong but now he felt STRONG, strong enough to break free of ropes if Kakashi tried tying him up again like during the bell test. It was hard to articulate all this so Naruto settled on taking a deep breath and grinning. "I feel...pretty great!"

Sasuke and Sakura both shared a look that clearly read "Seriously?". Typical Naruto, even adult sized he was still a brain dead goober. Yet it was also oddly reassuring to both kids. Naruto was, after all TYPICAL Naruto. Huge or not, he was himself. Kakashi couldn't contain a little smile as he heard this. "Well, that's good to hear at least. No body pain, no head pain, no abnormalities as far as you can tell?"

Naruto scratched his exposed stomach and rubbed the back of his head, tongue out, thinking. "Mmmmm, nope! Nothing like that! So since I'm not sick, how about we actually say a proper farewell to Tazuna and Inari and everyone!"

Kakashi's smile disappeared at that notion. "I really don't think that's wise Naruto. You may feel fine now but this still isn't a normal occurrence. We need to get you back home and have you looked over."

"Awwwww come on Kakashi-sensei!" Naruto whined, frowning at his teacher. "What's the harm in spending a few extra minutes here? It's not like I'm going to explode!"

"Well you did puff up before..." Sakura murmured, looking Naruto up and down.

"Come on Sakura, I thought you'd be on my side!" Naruto said, turning and looking down at his pink haired teammate. "You want to say good bye to everyone, right?"

"I mean...o-of course I do!" Sakura stuttered, feeling a bit...intimidated by the much larger Naruto in front of her. "But Kakashi-sensei is right, you need to get examined!"

"What about you Sasuke?" Naruto quickly asked, turning his intensity on his other teammate.

"I don't care, do what you want, idiot."

"See, Sasuke agrees with me!" Naruto said, a vein popping on his forehead. He reached over and wrapped his arm around Sasuke's head, yanking him to his side, pressing the shorter male's face against Naruto's exposed stomach, squeezing him in a merciless headlock. "So it's two against two! What do you say sensei? Willing to change your mind?"

Sasuke struggled mightily but couldn't break the death grip Naruto had on him. Sure Naruto had been strong at kid sized but was getting a bit taller really able to make him THIS much stronger? Kakashi felt a bit of a chill as he realized Naruto might have gotten physically strong enough to be a bit of a...problem. "Alright Naruto, we can say good bye. But just for a few minutes."

"YEAH!" Naruto cheered, jumping in the air, letting Sasuke go at the same time, knocking him to the ground. "The Great Naruto Uzumaki wins again! Let's go!"

"HOLD ON A SECOND NARUTO!" Sakura yelled, her eyes going white as she held up a clenched fist. "You can't just knock Sasuke to the ground like he's some trash and expect to get away with it! I'm going to pound you into the ground!"

Sakura charged and punched Naruto square in the stomach, the taller ninja gasping and bending over slightly, holding his midsection. "Aaaaaaah Sakuraaaaaaaa why'd you do that? I think I'm going to throw up..."

"You'd better not, or I'll really give you a beating!"

"Would you two please just shut up already?"

"Oh Sasuke, are you okay? That idiot didn't hurt you did he?"

"As if..."

Kakashi crossed his arms and watched all this in silence. Naruto was already treated rather poorly by the villagers; how exactly were they going to treat him now? At least Sasuke and Sakura had gotten over their shock and were treating him like normal...He cupped his hands around his mouth and shouted, "If you three want to get home sometime before dark, we should probably think about heading out."

"Not until Naruto makes himself decent!" Sakura quickly spoke up. "He can't go around looking like...that."

Naruto tugged at his jacket and shirt, looking a little put out. "Is it really that bad?"

"Sakura has a point. It's shocking enough that you're a twelve year old the size of an adult, the least we can do is make you more...presentable." Kakashi agreed.

"Do you have any spare clothes I can borrow sensei?" Naruto asked, an image of himself dressed up like Kakashi briefly entering his mind, mask and all.

"And have you walking around looking like an adult ninja when you haven't earned the ranks? I don't think so." Kakashi said blandly. "I'm sure we'll think of something, in the mean time, lets get moving."

As they turned to leave, they suddenly noticed that most of the village had gathered at the end of the bridge, looking at the ninja in awe. Tazuna and Inari were at the head of the crowd. Nobody said a word as the ninja approached...until Inari suddenly let out a snotty sounding sob, running forward and embracing Naruto, burying his face in his midsection. "Naruto! You...you...you did it! You really did it!"

Naruto chuckled, patting Inari on the head. "Yeah...WE did it!"

Cheers erupted from the crowd as everyone celebrated the ousting of the villains who had been preventing the construction of their bridge, Tazuna proudly declaring that the bridge would be named for the hero who had saved it, Naruto himself. A kind woman in the crowd also willingly donated a sheet to Naruto, who immediately wrapped it around his body in a toga like fashion, stripping off his jacket and shirt before doing so. Nobody made mention of Naruto's size outside a few compliments about how robust and strong he looked, so thankful were they for his assistance. Naruto's heart swelled with pride at his accomplishment and joy at how well he was treated. It made him feel...good. Helping people, protecting people, making bonds with people...Naruto was swiftly learning exactly what was most important to him.
11113212.title: Start of a New Adventure

111132122.content:
Naruto hummed cheerfully to himself as Team Seven walked home. The sun was shining, a warm breeze blew through his hair, and the cool grass felt wonderful beneath his feet. He was a hero! A real life hero! For the first time he'd had people look at him with happiness, respect, maybe even a little awe. Naruto liked it; he liked it a lot! Linking his hands behind his neck, he the over-sized blond couldn't help smiling, things were looking up.

*****************

Kyuubi grinned and hummed in satisfaction. All was going to plan. He could sense the awe and fear caused by his host. True, it had been a paltry amount, barely satisfying and not truly fit for a being of his immense powers. But, it was a beginning. His enhanced chakra had spread far and wide in the little brat's body, stretching, pushing outward, filling his vessel with supernatural strength and toughness. His power pressed at the seal always, now, just waiting for a change in pressure, any excuse to push outward once more, to continue his great work.

Kyuubi cocked his head, his long ear hearing something in the distance, a sound beyond sound. Nearby, hearts cried out for revenge; evil intentions focused on his container. The fox prepared...the brat would need chakra soon.

And he would have it.

******************

Naruto first realized something was wrong when a crossbow bold zipped by his cheek, drawing a shallow cut. Whirling around, he looked with wide eyes as a mercenary covered in mud and leaves dropped his crossbow and charged out of the bushes, sword in hand.

"Ambush!" Sasuke yelled from the front of the group, leaping for a tree and bringing his hand to his lips. Kakashi and Sakura spread out as well, making space; each team member found themselves with one or two enemies in the blink of an eye!

A kunai was in Naruto's hand without thought, and as he fell back in an awkward back stance he swiped wildly at the enemy's weapon. The angle was bad. The enemy had a charge behind the blow, and his weapon had the better reach. Yet when the two weapons connected with a loud clang, the sword was torn from the wicked man's grip and went flying into the forest.

The mercenary howled in pain, shaking his hands and leaping backward. Naruto stared; it looked like the force of their weapons meeting had launched his sword away and broken the man's fingers! But Naruto hadn't felt a thing; he hadn't even moved!

Grinning fiercely, Naruto advanced on the Mercenary, idly noting his teammates; they seemed to be doing fine. He could do this. He was so strong! This creep didn't stand a chance!

The creep had friends. At his panicked cry, three other men ran out of the woods, surrounding the blond ninja. Inexperienced, and focusing too much on his first enemy, Naruto was completely unprepared as he was surrounded. All four enemies launched themselves at him, grabbing him however they could and forcing him to the ground.

Naruto shouted and struggled, pushing up as hard as he could with the weight of four grown men on his back. Over the sound of one of Sasuke's pyro jutsus, and some weird chirping noise, Naruto heard the shink sound of a blade being drawn. The young ninja tensed, pupils contracting, as he frantically gathered his chakra to try and get out get out get out...

Thump pop pop pop

Naruto grunted as he felt an odd pulsing in his hands, his fingers felt odd, heavy, and his grip scrabbled as the ground seemed to shift under his palms and fingertips.

Thump creek

Blood and chakra rushed to Naruto's tired muscles, filling them with energy. His skin felt hot, and weirdly tight. Naruto felt a pounding in his bones, his muscles strained and cramped as they pushed harder than ever to get him free, and the enemies on his back started feeling lighter....and lighter...

Thump POP

With a mighty roar, Naruto tensed his arms and legs and pushed himself up. His tangled-up toga pulled at his chest and neck, strangling him almost as much as his enemies. He tugged at his neck, growling as he heard his emergency clothes tear slightly, but he took a deep grateful breath of free air. He heard shouts of surprise and fear as he rose to his feet, but he couldn't make out the words in his battle haze. Glaring at his enemies, Naruto snorted when he saw the brave idiot with the drawn knife drop his weapon and fall back a step. Really, he wouldn't have been nearly so freaked out if he'd realized the first goon's friends were so much tinier than their boss.

Striding forward, Naruto batted one of his enemies aside with one arm. The little jerk was blown off his feet, slamming into a nearby tree. As the other three tried to run, Naruto reached forward and snagged one by the neck with one hand, easily lifting the midget up to eye level. Glaring into his terrified enemy's eyes, Naruto raised his other fist and bopped him on the head. The tiny man's eyes instantly rolled up in their sockets and Naruto dropped his unconscious enemy in the dust.

The blond's ears twitched has he heard two thunks in the distance. Looking up, he moved his eyes from Sakura, who was in the end of a throwing stance, down the trail. The two little men who'd tried to get away were lying in the path, knocked out, with two head-sized rocks rolling to a stop beside them. Across the way, Kakashi and Sasuke had long since finished their own fights and were busy tying up and/or looting the would-be ambushers.

"Way to go, Sakura-Chan!" Naruto yelled. The blond winced; wow that had been loud!

Sakura turned to flash a grin and thumbs-up, but froze, staring.

Naruto frowned, looking down at his friend. What was wrong?

Wait. He was looking a long way down.

Slowly, Naruto walked toward his pink haired team-mate. With each step closer, it became more obvious. How his toga had pulled tight and ridden up so high he'd have to turn it sideways and wrap it around his hips to stay decent. How his strides got him close so fast. And when he stood by his friend, her head was level with Naruto's stomach.

Naruto swallowed, quickly adjusting his barely-covering-stuff toga to wrap it around his waist like a bath towel. Blushing slightly, Naruto tied off the cloth quickly and rubbed at his neck.

"Umm...poof? Eheh."

"Poof." Sakura agreed weakly.
.
111132122.title: Mercenary Madness, Chakra Changes, and Toga Towels

choices: "Yeah? What if I WANT to get bigger?"
1111321221.content:
Everyone stared at Naruto in wonder, even Kakashi. It wasn't often you saw a tall man with the proportions of a kid. Kakashi, who was once eye level with Naruto, was now staring at the young man's chest. Naruto had always had a larger than life personality but at kid size it was mostly just annoying; at his current height, however, it was difficult not to feel a little bit overwhelmed just by his presence. Kakashi quickly composed himself and said, "Well now...how about that hospital visit?"

Naruto chuckled and said, "Y-Yeah, seems like maybe that would be a good idea sensei."

The team moved on again, Naruto quickly taking the lead, his big feet stomping audibly as he charged forward. His teammates were quick to leap into the trees above them to move more quickly and Naruto followed suit, aiming for a lower, smaller branch to get a boost to the higher ones...only for his bare feet to snap the branch in two, sending him falling to the ground with a yelp, the wood turning to dust beneath his stompers as he landed, hard, on the dirt.

"Aim higher you idiot, you weigh more than you used to." Sasuke called out, taking the lead from Naruto.

"Grrrr! I'll show you Sasuke!" Naruto shouted, a vein popping on his forehead as he charged forward. Before he took a leap his shoulder accidentally clipped the trunk of a nearby tree, knocking it down with barely any effort. Naruto barely noticed as he was already in the air, aiming for the higher branches. He landed on a particularly thick one but it steal creaked alarmingly under his weight. Thinking fast, Naruto jumped again, this time spreading his weight about on two other branches as he landed, giving him a more solid jumping off point. He grinned as he soared through the air, easily catching up to and overtaking Sasuke, wind whipping around Naruto's body as his powerful leg muscles propelled him mightily forward. Sakura was caught in one of the cross breezes, lifting her up with a yelp and nearly sending her flying before she regained her composure. She felt the usual pang of annoyance but couldn't help being slightly impressed. Naruto was like a force of nature, indomitable and unstoppable, moving ever forward. She weakly chuckled as she imagined another ambush. Who would even try? It would be like attempting to stop a hurricane.

Kakashi, having seen far more impressive feats in his life than just an overgrown kid running around, wasn't in nearly as much awe but even he was impressed with how fast Naruto was adapting to a bigger body, finding new ways to move that suited his size and weight. Naruto, on the other hand, wasn't thinking too hard about anything except how COOL it was to be moving so fast! He took a particularly high leap and let out a whoop of joy as he sailed high above the trees, able to see the forest laid out before him like a carpet, before falling to the earth, purposefully missing the branches and landing on the ground, making a little impact crater where he landed, just outside the village gates. Dust surrounded him as he stood up to his full height, hands on his hips, a grin on his face. Once the dust cleared he knew he cut quite the impressive figure to anyone who was watching...though nobody was. Slightly disappointed, Naruto tilted his head up, shading his eyes with one hand as he took in the size of the gate. "Heh, wouldn't it be cool if I had to duck to get in through there? Everyone would be like little dolls compared to me...hehehehehehe~ Being able to just step over it would be really cool too..."

Naruto's heart started to pound faster as he imagined that. If people were impressed and treating him like a hero now, just how much would they look up to him if he was THAT big, both figuratively and literally? Maybe he'd be strong enough to be the youngest Hokage in the history of the village...

Naruto was knocked from these fantasies as Kakashi and the others arrived, his sensei bopping him on the back of his head. "Hospital. Now."

"Yeah, yeah..." Naruto mumbled, walking forward, his mind still shuffling the ideas of being not just big but really, REALLY big in his head. It didn't take long to reach the hospital but Naruto relished the attention he got. Whispers, impressed looks, people finally having to look UP at him rather than down AT him. A couple of people were intimidated and seemed to go out of their way to avoid him but Naruto couldn't be bothered by the negative attention when so much positive attention was being lavished on him. He thumbed his nose with a grin at a passing kid who laughed before walking into the hospital. The receptionist froze as she saw the rather huge kid walking through the front doors.

"Um...can I help you?" She asked, thinking to herself "Oh I can't WAIT to hear the explanation behind THIS one."

"Yes, hopefully." Kakashi said, indicating Naruto. "As you can see we have a bit of a problem on our hands and need my student here to be examined. Full body, every test, no holding back."

"S-Sensei, hang on, I didn't agree to any weird tests!" Naruto said, looking a little nervous, which looked rather odd on such a large person.

"Don't worry, nobody is going to be doing any weird experiments." The receptionist said soothingly. "Now then, Dr. Ando will be able to see you immediately. He's right down the hall, last door on the left."

Kakashi turned to Sasuke and Sakura and said, "You two can report back to the Hokage. Let him know what's going on and I'll supplement the report with whatever we learn from this examination. Understood?"

"Right!" Sakura said, nodding with determination while Sasuke just shrugged and walked off.

Dr. Ando reacted much the same way everyone else did when they spied Naruto, eyes widening as his mouth dropped open slightly. "W-Well! Naruto! You've certainly...changed since your last check up."

Naruto chuckled, blushing slightly. "Uh...I'm just a growing boy? Ehehehehehe...~"

"First things first, let me just...draw some blood." Dr. Ando said, pulling out a needle and sticking it into Naruto's arm. Naruto winced, expecting a sharp pain...but felt nothing. The doctor seemed a bit surprised and pressed harder against Naruto's skin, the needle not pushing through at all. "Odd..." He mumbled as he pushed even harder, finally managing to pierce the skin, drawing some blood out.

Naruto rubbed his arm before noticing the wound almost immediately healing, much faster than it normally did, even with his...special abilities. The doctor didn't seem to notice, putting a band aid down over the "wound". As he proceeded with the usual tests of reflex, blood pressure, and heart and lungs, Dr. Ando asked Naruto questions. "So, what brought this sudden growth about?"

"Well I was on a mission and I was fighting against someone and I was losing and I started to use my chakra and...uh...well..." Naruto rattled off, looking over to Kakashi for support.

"He used an excessive amount of chakra." Kakashi explained, not wanting to alarm the doctor by mentioning how the Fox's chakra had almost gotten out.

"Y-Yeah! And I could feel all this tightness in my skin and my heart pounded and I felt this swelling, popping feeling all over my body. And I got big!" Naruto concluded.

"I see...from what I'm seeing here, it seems like your skin has taken on an unnatural toughness. It's just as soft and pliable as regular skin but my needle could barely push through, almost like you're wearing body armor of some kind. I wouldn't advise getting stabbed with a kunai but you might find it not hurting as much as it otherwise would have. Not only that but there's a strange tightness and density in your muscles, like they're coiled up and ready to spring. This is not a bad thing, mind you, because it just means that you're a lot stronger than you look...by quite a large margin. I'm going to run some blood tests just to be sure but from what I can tell you're as healthy as can be...better than most in fact! Whatever is causing this seems to have nothing but positive effects for you. Either way, I'll be right back."

When the doctor left the room Kakashi turned to Naruto and said, "You're one lucky kid. I was expecting him to say this added size and mass was having a detrimental effect on your body. I think it's obvious what is causing this though: the Kyuubi."

"Yeah, no kidding..." Naruto mumbled, touching his stomach slightly. "But I mean...at least I'm not dying or anything, right? This is a good thing! Finally this stupid fox is doing something positive!"

"Naruto, this is not a game." Kakashi warned sternly, staring Naruto in the eyes...which he could do, because Naruto was sitting. "You started growing when you were in a tight spot and used a lot of chakra; for the time being you can't use any excessive amounts of chakra, understand? In the long run, you're going to have to learn better chakra control as well so you don't end up getting any bigger."

Naruto mulled this over in his mind. If he learned more chakra control he'd stop getting bigger...people would stop looking up to him in awe...he'd go back to being just a runty kid who nobody paid any attention to...and this feeling of power, of weight, of significance would go away...but what if Kakashi was right? What if it was too dangerous to be playing around with this? What if he lost control? He frowned and turned to face his sensei, his mind made up.
1111321221.title: Hustle to the Hospital

choices: At least Naruto can still crawl through doors and hallways
11113212211.content:
"Yeah right!" Naruto yelled, crossing his arms in a giant "X".

"I like being big!" Naruto hopped to his feet and posed, puffing his chest out to try and look even bigger. The over-sized ninja couldn't help feeling a bit smug when his aggressive posing made his big bad sensei take a step back. Well, maybe 'medium bad' sensei. 'Mini sensei'....anyway! No way was he going back to the way things were! In fact, the more Naruto thought about it, everything had been great since he got so big; his team was nicer, fighting was easier, and nobody had treated him bad!

"Naruto, hold on a second." Kakashi held up his hands, feeling a cold sweat on his brow.

Naruto was not holding on to anything! Mind focusing, the blond crossed his fingers and pulled on his chakra hard. A visible haze of blue burning into the world around him, kicking up a windstorm in the office that forced Kakshi to skid back on his feet.

This thing was happening!


*****************************************

Kyuubi laughed as he saw the brat's chakra pathways dilate so much that it had to hurt. The fox spirit's face lit up with a mean-spirited smirk as the titanic being wrapped his giant arms around his stockpile of enhanced chakra and held it close while his cage howled from the strain.

"Looks like the brat likes it. Too bad for him Kurama doesn't do tricks on demand. Your body is MINE to enhance, brat! YOU HEAR ME?!"

The fox scowled as it saw a few wisps of his chakra get yanked along into the storm.

"Tch. Fine, kid. Steal a few scraps. Let's see how much you enjoy things without my help. Either way, you'll just come back with an even bigger appetite!"

*****************************************

Nothing was happening.

Naruto winced at the strain, and slowly brought down his arms. He didn't feel any different. No stretching, no rush of power. Kakashi-sensei was still glaring from around the same level...

Oh, yeah.

"Heheh...um, I guess I got carried away?" Naruto asked weakly.

Sensei was not amused. Kakashi was quick to offer punishment in the form of a powerful bop to the head.

"OW!" Naruto winced, rubbing his scalp. "Mean! What was that for, huh?!"

"I specifically told you not to pull a lot of chakra. They probably felt that in Kumo!" Kakashi raged. "And what if that had worked, huh? Do you know how much it would affect you this time? You're inside a hospital full of sick, immobile patients!"

Naruto looked down, ashamed. He hadn't thought about that, he'd just been so excited! The thought of being Konoha's own giant protector was just so awesome to think about. But he didn't want to blow up the hospital! Heroes don't do stuff like that; no, he should have waited until some giant lizard monster attacked, and then stood outside the gates while a few leaves blew by in the wind, and -

"Oh." Naruto let out a startled gasp, as he felt his body give a wriggle. He swallowed heavily as his heart started pounding in his veins. Suddenly a lot more worried about being inside, and super mad he hadn't thought this through, Naruto looked around frantically, eyes locking on a small window behind Kakashi.

Success! An outer wall, with escape.

"Sensei - " Naruto started, wincing as he felt his bones start buzzing.

"Still mad at you." Kakashi grunted.

"No, Sensei, I think it woahhh!" Naruto shouted in alarm as his legs and arms shot outward, his height shooting up until his head smacked into the ceiling.

"OW!"

Something was wrong; the growth had never been that fast or uneven before!

Bending down, Naruto watched his Sensei jump back with wide eyes as his hands and feet popped out larger one digit at a time. Pop pop pop. As he felt his left foot lurch out, Naruto teetered off balance until he fell hard onto his side, knocking over medical supplies and tipping the trash out onto the floor. Looking up, the young ninja scrabbled with his hands, knocking his teacher in the side and accidentally kicking the bed into the exam room door. Feeling a bit like he'd been stretched into taffy, the weirdly lanky teen ignored his teacher shouting and yelled in triumph as his hands found the window.

Grunting with effort as his not-yet-grown muscles pulled along a lot more weight, Naruto tugged himself into the window, and started cramming himself through.

Snap. Naruto groaned and wriggled as he felt his shoulders pushing out, quickly becoming wider than the window. One of his arms was stuck along his side, the other dangled down outside the hospital, his fingertips barely finding a grip on the top of the window a story below. Already feeling pressure as his muscles started catching up with his bones, Naruto quickly used his increasing strength to pull himself forward. He felt the lower window's frame start to crumple a bit in his grip as his widening chest and bicep wedged him even more snugly in place. The final nail in the coffin was when Naruto felt his hips start growing; by that time the window frame had pulled tight around his middle, and he was officially bigger on both ends with nowhere to go.

The Third Hokage's first meeting with "Konoha's new giant protector" was from outside the hospital, along with several ANBU. Naruto did his best to pretend he had any dignity left as he waited, stuck in a window, for help.

Kakashi sensei did not hesitate to let Naruto know that while he waited, half the hospital staff had managed to clear the office doorway he'd smashed shut, and had therefore seen his trapped, naked butt.

Yep...dignity.
.
11113212211.title: Back for Seconds

choices: Kakashi gets called away before he can perform the seal, leaving Naruto alone
After getting sealed, Naruto runs into some old acquaintances
111132122111.content:
There was silence as the Third Hokage stared at Naruto's face, the younger ninja's cheeks turning redder every second that the older man refused to speak, his hands tucked behind his back, eyes inscrutable. The ANBU, all masked, were equally as silent and staring, making Naruto gulp loudly. Wildly, he suddenly realized his butt itched and he couldn't even do anything to scratch it! And people back there were staring at him too! It was enough to break out into a cold sweat! Sure, it had been nice to be getting looks before but this was ridiculous!

Finally, ending his silent torment, the Third Hokage sighed, eyes closing briefly as he put his pipe in his mouth and lit it, taking a long draw on it before turning his eyes back up to Naruto. "So, I've heard you've been getting into some trouble Naruto."

"Y-You could say that..." Naruto mumbled, his voice still surprisingly loud. The ANBU shifted slightly, surprised by the volume.

"I feel confident in confiding in you that we are as surprised as you. When my successor, the Fourth Hokage, sealed the Fox within you there was never any mention of this being a possibility. It seems the Fox is even craftier than we had first believed. We are entirely in uncharted territory."

Naruto gulped again; he was used to adults being more cryptic and mysterious about his situation. It was almost uncomfortable the Third Hokage was being so frank. "So....what are we...uh...going to do about it?"

"That is an excellent question." The old man replied, smiling slightly. "Under the circumstances I would say that it would be wisest to bar you from performing your duties as a ninja, to make sure that you stay hidden and never access your chakra again, or at least until we figure out a way to prevent the Fox from exacerbating this problem."

"W-What?! Come on old man, you can't do that to me!" Naruto protested, his embarrassment washed briefly away in a storm of outrage, his dream of being Hokage seeming to disappear before his very eyes. "I can still fight and do missions and stuff without chakra! Look how big I am! I'm really strong too! I-I can...I can..."

He wiggled desperately his confines, the window frame creaking and groaning under the strain of his giant body. The Third Hokage raised his hand, stemming Naruto's words, the giant ninja stopping, cracks evident all along the wall where he struggled. "I said that would be the wisest decision, not the one I was intending to pursue. Trying to keep you from doing your duties as a ninja would be like attempting to contain a hurricane; in the end, it would merely spiral out of all control. Instead, I think it would be best if we place a secondary seal on your chakra, making it more difficult to access the foreign chakra inside you. I believe Kakashi knows of one."

"I do but it does rely on the recipient's will power to keep in place and Naruto has already proven himself to be a bit...enthusiastic when it comes to his new...abilities." Kakashi's muffled voice was heard on the other side of the wall.

"I-I'll be good! I promise!" Naruto said, eyes pleading with the old man. "If it means I can still be with my team and go on missions and stuff I'll do whatever it takes!"

"I expected nothing less of you." Sarutobi said, nodding his head. "Very well! I will leave the rest to you Kakashi. After you're finished with the situation here I will expect a more comprehensive report on the your latest mission."

"Understood."

Naruto suddenly reached his free arm out, holding his palm out in front of the older man as he turned to walk away. "W-Wait!"

The ANBU moved swiftly, pinning Naruto's arm down, stepping on his fingers, keeping him from moving. "O-Ouch! Hey! What gives?!"

Not thinking the situation through, Naruto grunted and lifted his arm up, clenching his fingers into a fist and flexing his bicep, throwing the ANBU to the ground around him. Before things could escalate the Third Hokage shouted, "ENOUGH!"

Everyone held still, Naruto's arm flopping back down to the ground. "What is it Naruto?"

"I'm still kind of...um...you know...naked." He whispered this last word but it was still perfectly audible to all present.

"Hmmm...unfortunately there is no clothing in the Leaf Village that will fit your current size. Even the Akimichi clan's clothing is made to grow, not to fit one already grown. It will take a few days but I'll find you more suitable attire, something closer to what you're used to wearing."

"Thanks old man! I really appreciate it! Everything!" Naruto said, a smile lighting up his features. It was reassuring to see through all the changes and uncertainties, Naruto was still Naruto.

"In the mean time, I'm sure the hospital will be more than willing to provide something."

"Yes Lord Third!" A chorus of voices intoned from inside the building.

And with that, the Hokage and his entourage departed, leaving Naruto alone with Kakashi and the hospital staff. "Hey Kakashi-sensei?"

"Yes Naruto?"

"How am I gonna get out of here?"

It took at least five people on each side, gently pushing and pulling before Naruto was eased out of the window frame, the glass and wood damaged beyond repair. Naruto, sitting cross legged and covering himself, chuckled nervously and said, "Uh...I'll pay to fix that."

"Consider the funds from your last mission spent, kid." Kakashi said, crossing his arms in front of the enormous ninja. Even sitting down Naruto was taller and quite a bit wider than Kakashi; even though Naruto's height had increased, somewhat irregularly due to his uncontrolled chakra grab, he still had the thickness and proportions of a 13 year old, making him heavier and stronger than even an adult would be at the same size. "Now, while we were getting you unstuck the hospital was also kind enough to sew you a temporary covering for your...shame. So thank the nice staff."

Naruto turned and bowed. "Thank you!"

Nobody responded beyond a few nervous nods, three people handing Naruto what looked like a table cloth but was actually some crudely fashioned underwear made from bed sheets. It was shaped like a loincloth in front and back, the sides bare, while a loop of fabric went under his crotch, covering anything that might be visible from below. After struggling a bit to get them on, Naruto turned to Kakashi who indicated the door. "You're not too huge to move through the halls, get a move on."

Naruto sighed and squeezed himself through the doorway, having to turn and wiggle a bit to make it through, his shoulders and chest being the most troublesome. Luckily he managed to get through with only slightly damaging the door frame. Even out in the spacious halls of the hospital Naruto found his shoulders bumping against either wall, his back and shoulders hitting the ceiling. "This sucks...I feel like a little kid in a tunnel or something...." Naruto grumbled.

"You only have yourself to blame." Kakashi reminded him, standing in front and clearing the way for the giant Genin. Once outside, Naruto gratefully rose to his feet and stretched, sighing happily, the warm sun feeling good against his mostly exposed body. His hands fell to his hips and he looked around proudly, feeling a sense of pride again as he realized how far he could see from his new vantage point. "Gonna have to think about finding a new place to live...something a little...bigger."

"First things first." Kakashi said, drawing Naruto's attention down around his thighs. "I need to get that seal on you."

"Right! And after that, I think I'm going to take a nice long walk around the village~" Naruto said, smirking slightly. Now that he was somewhat clothed and less embarrassed he was starting to enjoy his size again.

As the two walked away, the crowds parting in awe of the towering teen, three other teens were watching from a distance. "So...you ever see anything like that before, Temari?"

"Can't say I have Kankuro. What about you, Gaara?"

"..."

"Well...maybe these Chunin Exams are going to be even more interesting than we thought."
111132122111.title: Planning Ahead

1111321221111.content:
Naruto walked slowly through the streets, basking in the sun rays and the people that are looking at him, while Kakashi warily trailed behind his towering student to get to a more remote location to apply the seal and also to keep the boy from doing any unnecessary things that might draw attention, well, more attention than before anyway.

He was knocked out of his musings from a tap on the shoulder as he turned around to see that a Jounin was trying to get his attention.

"Hey Kakashi, The Hokage wishes to talk to you about what happened in Wave to see how your student..." He said before gesturing to the oversized blond who looked at who was talking to his Sensei, "...Has gotten so large in the first place from his little problem, the circumstances and to work with how the seal will be implemented for him." He informed him whom nodded in understanding.

"Alright, do you want me to bring him along too?" He asked pointing his thumb behind him to Naruto, who chuckled a bit nervously about having to be in such tight quarters again.

"Nah, you seen him? The halls in the Tower is too damn small for the kid to fit through and it'd be uncomfortable, and I'm not gonna be the one to find someone to clean the mess he leaves behind." He said shaking his head.

Naruto interjected since he didn't like not having a voice in this conversation as he walked over and looked down at them, "Hey don't I get a say in this? Don't worry Kakashi-Sensei, I promise I won't get into any more trouble." He said to him as the man sighed.

"And that's what I'm most afraid of, but if you said you got this and if you're a ninja then you're practically an adult, then who am I to judge? Just stay from touching the chakra, no matter how enticing it might be until I get back okay?" Kakashi asked him sternly.

Despite the subconscious desire to take in even more of the chakra, Naruto also wants to keep being a ninja and maybe even become the first giant hokage!

"Yea I'll try to keep it under control." Naruto promised as he nodded in appreciation and turned to his fellow Jounin, "Alright, off we go." He said and they walked away, leaving Naruto by himself.

The boy thought to himself, 'Alright so the Chunin Exams are coming up soon, maybe I should go and train a bit? Though, I am pretty strong as is, it should be a piece of cake, or maybe go walk around the village for a bit more?' He considered the pros and cons and came to a decision.
1111321221111.title: Kakashi gets called away before he can perform ...

choices: Kakashi finds him. Naruto has a remote trigger explosive seal on his neck
Kakashi finds him. Naruto is even bigger, but he can't remember why
11113212211112.content:
Naruto grinned as he walked along the outskirts of the village, hands behind his head with the sun shining at his back. Running ahead of him was a massive shadow, covering half the street. It was so funny to see the villagers stop what they were doing whenever his massive body blocked out the sun; they'd look around confused before freezing, and then slowly looked waaaaaaay up to meet his gaze. Some of them jumped up and ran, or at least Naruto thought they were running. Their tiny little legs didn't really help them reach anything more than a brisk walk to the giant blond. One lady fainted after she turned to look out of her second story window to see Naruto cheerfully waving at her, his eyes just clearing the window sill (on the second floor!)

It was nice to walk in the street though; after crawling through the hospital Naruto had started to worry about having space to move around, but while he was really tall, he wasn't as wide as the carts in the road. Naruto wondered if he counted as traffic now.

"-id. Hey KID!"

Naruto blinked, before peering down. Standing in front of him, and looking a bit impatient, was another Jonin. Dropping to a knee, the giant ninja crouched down to speak to the superior ninja on sort-of eye level. He did his best not to laugh when he noticed his breath was blowing the guy's hair back.

"Yeah?" Naruto asked. The Jonin winced a bit and covered his ears.

"Got a message for ya'," the older ninja waved his hand in greeting. "Hokage's set up a chamber for the sealing; it's an old emergency bunker with a wide door and a large chamber only a few yards in."

Naruto huffed (the Jonin's hair was now a complete mess) and crossed his arms petulantly.

"I still don't think I need a dumb seal. I've got everything under control!"

"Yeah..." The Jonin offered a not-at-all convincing sound of agreement as he turned and started walking away.

Naruto hurriedly rose to his feet and took a few quick steps, only to freeze when he realized he'd overtaken his guide. Laughing sheepishly, Naruto waited for his tiny guide to get a bit of a lead and started a slow awkward lope behind him. After the first near miss, the Jonin was keeping half an eye on the kid; he'd almost gotten kicked into a wall!

In fairly short order, the pair made it to a large iron door. Well....large-ish. Naruto was going to have to crawl again, but at least he wouldn't get stuck. The Jonin quickly gave a series of carefully timed knocks, then led the way down the newly opened passage, Naruto blocking out nearly all of the outside light behind him. As the gening slid his legs through, the door slowly closed.


********

Kakashi frowned as he heard the sound of highly secure doors closing. The Jonin guide hadn't entered the office with him; not against protocol exactly, but usually the Hokage wanted his visitors announced...and watched from behind.

Sarutobi looked up in surprise and a bit of irritation as he tucked away his pipe.

"Kakashi. I thought you'd be placing the seal on Naruto right now. Was there something too important to wait? I can hardly imagine what it could be."

"Sir..." Kakashi answered slowly. "Didn't you summon me for an immediate debriefing?"

The Hokage's answer was to toss off his casual robes, showing carefully arranged bracers and ever-ready kunai pouches beneath, as he jumped out the window. Kakshi followed without hesitation.

"I did not." Sarutobi answered shortly as the pair hopped along the rooftops in search of one giant ninja. "Who told you this?"

"A Konoha Jonin. Or at least he looked like one. I've seen him in the village though I don't know him by name." Kakashi answered, cursing himself for his antisocial attitude to his colleagues. "His clothing was in the pre-approved arrangement to show he was on Konoha business, and he smelled like a local."

"I'll want a full description." Sarutobi muttered as the pair finally found a mostly-cleared street that showed evidence of multiple civilians running off in a hurry. Given Naruto's appearence and...relative levels of tact, this seemed like a good lead.

**********

Naruto woke up with a splitting headache, to find himself lying on his back in a small out-of-the way training ground. Sitting up, the giant ninja blinked in confusion as he took in his surroundings.

"Wha?" He muttered, stretching out his limbs and shaking some feeling into his hands.

The last thing he remembered was crawling....and it was dark? Naruto winced, the headache flaring up a bit. No, he'd crawled out of the hospital, because it was super tiny in there, and Kakashi had been staring at him with his creepy red eye...no. No that wasn't right....Kakashi had followed him out. He'd gotten that seal jiji wanted...or was Kakashi called away? There'd been a weird Jonin guy...

Naruto turned his head and sicked up a bit in the grass, his headache made his stomach hurt. Panting, the ninja raised a shaking arm to wipe sweat from his forehead.

What had happened? And why couldn't he remember?
.
11113212211112.title: Stranger Danger

choices: Naruto finally gets sealed but will it last?
Naruto runs into some old friends.
111132122111122.content:
As Naruto tried to remember what had just happened to him a soft sound like cat's feet made itself known to him at the edge of the clearing. The training ground, like most things in the Leaf Village, was situated somewhere in the forest but Naruto wasn't exactly familiar with which one this was. It seemed that it was far enough away from the Village, however, that the bustling sounds of commerce and every day life was gone completely, thus allowing Naruto to hear the soft step of Kakashi's arrival. "K-Kakashi-sensei?" Naruto asked, his voice shaking slightly, his eyes a bit unfocused. "Is that you?"

"You've got some good ears on you kid." Kakashi replied, stepping forward, one hand in his pocket. "So...care to tell me what happened since I've been gone?"

"Mmm..." Naruto said, closing his eyes and pressing the butt of his palm against them, lips turning down in a grimace as he tried to remember. "I was walking around the village...then this guy came up to me and said...something about sealing? The old man said...wait...or did you say...or...argh! I can't remember!"

Naruto's voice rose slightly, pounding his fist into the ground. Kakashi stopped walking towards the huge kid, bracing himself as the entire training ground shook. "Easy Naruto, easy. Don't push yourself. Just tell me everything you can remember, okay?"

Naruto nodded and sat down, gingerly, cross legged, eyes still closed. "You had to go leave to talk to the old man, that much I remember for sure. I was walking around and kind of...you know...showing myself off to the village. So people would know I'm here and protecting them and stuff..."

"And so you could get some admiring looks I'm sure." Kakashi intoned dully, though there was a hint of a smile under his mask in spite of himself.

Naruto chuckled, rubbing the back of his head. "Yeah, maybe...anyway...things start getting foggy here."

"How many people do you remember?"

"There was...just one guy...and he was dressed like...like a Jonin so...you know, it was a uniform and...the face wasn't familiar...I don't think..." Naruto scratched his head, closed eyelids scrunching a little bit as he struggled.

"Alright, so one guy, that sounds about right." Kakashi encouraged. "Then?"

"Oh! A cave! No...some kind of...underground warehouse?" Naruto excitedly recalled, eyes flying open, a hand pounding his open palm. "We went in and then everything gets fuzzy again..."

"Underground warehouse, huh..." Kakashi mumbled, thinking about all the possible locations that fit that description. "So it's possible we're dealing with more than one person here after all..."

"Anyway, I remember crawling down a hallway but then everything goes dark and I woke up here with a huge headache." Naruto finished, opening his eyes and looking down at Kakashi for the first time in that moment. Way down.

Wait a minute....

"Sensei! You're...smaller!" Naruto gasped, struggling to his feet, measuring himself against the Jonin. He looked around wildly, noticing how his head was near the canopy of the trees, his teacher standing about even with his knees now, looking even more child like next to the enormous child. "Which means...aw man! I'm bigger again! What the heck?!"

"Calm down Naruto, lets just take it easy. Whatever happened to you down...you were obviously forced into using the Fox's chakra again. You've only grown about another...five, six feet? I'd say you're about twenty feet tall now, even height with a two story building."

Naruto remembered how just a few moments ago (to him anyway) he had been about eye height to a second story window. Now it seemed as though he'd have to bend over slightly to be at that height. "So much for being indoors..." He mumbled in annoyance, tugging at his makeshift undergarments. The growth had forcibly loosened the sheets, leaving him with something that looked less like a loincloth and more like a tight fitting pair of briefs. "The old man better get me some fitting clothes fast unless everyone wants to see my ass running around town!"

Naruto shouted, his voice powerful and booming to Kakashi's ears, several birds taking flight just from the sheer volume of Naruto's bellow. Kakashi sighed and indicated Naruto should lower himself. The rambunctious kid did as he was told and sank back down to a seated position, his bright blue eyes fixed fully on Kakashi. It was...undeniably intimidating, even for a seasoned warrior like Kakashi. "Listen...I'm going to share with you some information that I normally never would because our situation has just gone from bad to worse. You understand?"

"No." Naruto said simply, crossing his arms, a look of confusion on his face.

"Good. You're not supposed to. I'm sure you're aware of the Chunin exams coming up?

"Of course! Everyone knows about those! It's my first shot to climb the ladder! To rank up! To get closer to my goal of being Hokage!" Naruto grinned, clenching his hand into a fist, breathing slightly faster in excitement.

"Right. Well, this year we're hosting the exams with another village, the Hidden Sand Village. How much do you know about them?"

"Uh...they...have...sand?" Naruto said.

"So nothing, then. Alright, tensions between our villages have been high for a long time for...various reasons. I'm not going to go into all the gritty details right now because it's not important to the current situation. We have reason to believe that the Sand Village may be...planning something, in collusion with a smaller Hidden Village that has recently been formed. The details are shaky right now since they've been very good about hiding their tracks."

"So you think these Sand punks are going to try and pull something during the exam?!" Naruto growled. "No way! I'm not going to let anything get in my way! Just point me at these jerks and I'll--"

"Get knocked out." Kakashi interrupted, Naruto's voice sounding like it was being broadcast over a loudspeaker whenever he grew more impassioned. "That Jonin you met today probably was working, in some form, with them. That's the hypothesis at least. Nothing is certain except that someone is showing some kind of interest in you and, judging by how you had to use the Fox's chakra, it can't be anything good."

"Huh...why would I use the Fox's chakra, though, if it was just one guy? I'm even stronger than I look, my breath was messing with that guy before! I could have just swatted him aside."

"I was thinking the same thing." Kakashi nodded. "Which leads me to believe there was more than one opponent down there. One ninja is one thing, even a skilled one can be overwhelmed by pure force. But pure force can also be overwhelmed by skill and numbers. Either way, it's even more important now that we get you sealed."

What Kakashi didn't say, knowing that Naruto would only get even more riled up than he already was, is that he wasn't sure if the giant Genin would be allowed to participate in the Chunin Exams due to his...size predicament. "Let someone else tell him that he can't participate...see how well it goes." Kakashi thought to himself.

"So what's our next move now, sensei?" Naruto asked, leaning in slightly, casting a shadow over the smaller adult.

"Our next move is to get you sealed, and quickly." Kakashi said, firmly. "I know you think you can handle this and I'm not going to say you can't but we're talking about a real threat to the entire village here. If you're forced to use this chakra again you might cause some real damage."

"I know, I know..." Naruto said, sighing, not liking the idea of being forced into cutting off parts of his chakra, even if it wasn't technically his. "I mean...the Fox is in MY body, right? So doesn't that make it my chakra?"

Naruto thought that to himself, much to the chagrin of the Fox within, the monstrous chakra construct growling and seeing red. Naruto felt a shiver run up and down his spine but shook it off. "Anyway...if these guys are so bad why are they trying to make me bigger and stronger? Seems pretty dumb to me."

"Is it? Imagine, for a moment, being the size you are and running down the street without paying too much attention. Think of the damage you could cause by being too excited or careless. You're not the type to sit still after all. Now imagine if you were twice your size. Or a dozen times larger. Think of all the chaos you could unleash with just walking."

Naruto's eyes widened as he considered the possibility. "I never thought of it like that before...do you really think I could get THAT big?"

"I'm not ruling it out." Kakashi muttered.

"Fine, fine, let's just get this...seal thing over with already." Naruto sighed, getting to his feet. "Do you want me to carry you, sensei?"

"The hell I do, I'm not your pet." Kakashi replied. Naruto grinned and bent down slightly, laying his heavy palm on top of Kakashi's head and rubbing it gently, messing up his hair and nearly knocking the older man down.

"You sure do look and feel like one though!" Naruto chuckled, straightening back up and walking. "Then you'd better keep up sensei! I've got long legs and I wanna use 'em!"

Kakashi quickly took off after Naruto, the giant ninja's steps causing the ground to tremble. "This is going to be a very long day..."
111132122111122.title: Foggy Memories

choices: The Seal was completed but it was Faulty.
The Seal was completed with no mistakes...for now.
1111321221111221.content:
They managed to get to a proper clearing away from any nearby civilian presence, since his giant genin student was incapable of getting into any underground facility or inside anywhere in this case.

But he'll have to make due with what they have at the moment and get it over with.

"So, how are we gonna do this Kakashi-Sensei?" Naruto asked looking down at him as Kakashi sweatdropped a bit, Naruto is rather intimidating at that size especially when he's looking at him with those big blue eyes of his.

"Well first I want you to lie down flat on the ground for me Naruto, the Demon Fox Seal is on your stomach and seeing as you're towering over me I need you to lay on the floor." He instructed as Naruto nodded in understanding.

"Okay, you should probably move over a tad bit." Naruto advised as he shifted his weight a bit as he began to sit down, the ground shook from his movements as he sat down and laid back.

"Like this?" He asked him as Kakashi nodded in approval.

"Yea, just give me a second now." He said before walking over to his student's side and started to clamber up the arm and walked on it until he was standing on top of his stomach which made Naruto giggle a bit from the ticklish feeling from Kakashi standing and trying to find balance on his stomach.

"Naruto I need you to be still for a moment so I can apply the seal properly so no mistakes can be made." He sternly told him as he got the message immediately.

"Okay Sensei, I'll do the best I can." Naruto replied raising his head up a bit to see what he's doing.

'Okay, should be right about...here.' Kakashi thought to himself as he touched the stomach with his hand focused chakra on it as the Demon Fox Seal appeared, breathing carefully he began to funnel chakra into a brand new seal ontop of it as he put his entire attention to it, he can't make any mistakes or Naruto moved around too much it could make for a faulty seal, which would be...bad.
1111321221111221.title: Naruto finally gets sealed but will it last?

choices: Naruto Wakes up to a Curious Konohamru Climbing all Over Him
Kyuubi Wakes up to a New Seal
11113212211112212.content:
"There," Kakashi announced, hopping off of his student's stomach with a forced grin. "It looks like the seal took."

Naruto pushed up, his hands sinking into the earth as his weight compressed the soil, and rose to a seated position. The giant genin poked at his stomach dubiously. He now had a giant black circle of symbols surrounding where his normal seal appeared when he channeled the Fox's chakra. Except he wasn't channeling that chakra, so it was just a big black circle tatoo.

"That looks dumb!" Naruto complained, flopping onto his back with a pout.

Boom

Naruto coughed as the air around his head filled with a cloud of dirt, kicked up by his weight and the speed of his fall.

"Don't do that!" Mini-sensei scolded, hopping back. "And it doesn't look dumb! That seal should bolster your original, and help prevent the Fox flooding your system when your focus lapses. Just remember it's powered by your will, so while it pushes against the Fox you need to be careful not to pull any of it's chakra, because the new seal doesn't stop that at all."

***
Within the seal, a roughed-up looking, loopy fox snorted in its healing sleep. Although it wasn't awake, some impulse told the fox instinctively that it was time for a diabolical laugh.

"Muahahahaaaa....snore.....hahahahaaaaa."
***

"So..." Naruto frowned, turning on his side to keep his teacher in view. "So if I wanted to get bigger..." Naruto pictured himself in his mind's eye, trying to work this out, and imagined himself stretching taller, and taller, and-

"Cut that out!" Kakashi yelped.

Startled, Naruto's eyes popped open. Looking down, he blinked in surprise at how faded and frayed the seal looked. A moment of focus later, and it was back to looking like a dumb, solid black circle.

"Like I said, the seal doesn't fight you. It can't, all of it's force is directed inward. You can override it at any time. And you must not grow again."

Naruto grumbled, turning onto his back. He didn't understand what the big deal was; there were like a million ways being this big could be super helpful. There were probably whole new missions that nobody thought of before that he could do, or maybe Choji's clan did those already, but so what! They had to use a technique to grow, so that meant they couldn't stay big, right? So Naruto was a...some sort of per-ma-nent al-ter-na-tive...thing. Yeah!

"Also you're sleeping here."

"WHAAAAT?"

Naruto stared at his teacher in horror. He couldn't sleep here! It was cold, and uncomfortable, and dirty, and...and he was almost naked!

Kakashi winced in pain, and hoped the Hokage had dispersed some officials to explain away all these freakishly loud outbursts. It was bound to upset the villagers.

"Look," he sighed, rubbing his head. "You could have used your apartment about ten feet ago, but then you had the genius idea to grow again. And now even the emergency shelters are off the table; you're just too big! There's some warehouses we can re-purpose by tomorrow, probably, though we'll have to buy out the people leasing the space or commandeer it which would piss them off. We'll figure something out. The point is tonight you don't have a lot of options, kid."

"But..." Naruto whined softly.

Kakashi walked over and patted his student on the shoulder, an option he only had because the kid was lying down. He wondered if the kid even felt it, but as Naruto's expression softened he figured maybe it was the thought that counted.

"It's just for one night. We'll have people keeping watch. I'll be keeping watch, personally. It's not ideal, but it'll be safe. Promise."

As Naruto slowly drifted off to sleep, Kakashi just hoped that he could keep that promise.
.
11113212211112212.title: A Stronger Seal

choices: Meanwhile, what's the talk around the Village?
111132122111122121.content:
Naruto was not having a good night. He had been on dozens of missions, some of which required that he sleep outside, on the cold hard ground, but none had ever been as bad as this. The only scrap of clothing he had was getting more and more tattered by the moment as his big body shifted around, trying to get comfortable, finding that the only way he could get even remotely satisfied with his position was on his back, legs stretched out, the cold air nipping at his long limbs. He managed to fall into a fitful sleep but he shivered and his mind was filled with half formed images of foxes and toy houses and screams. Everyone's warnings were starting to weigh heavy in his mind. What if the villagers truly did despise him even more than they already did because of this? What if he was an unsustainable burden on everyone? It was hurtful and frustrating and all Naruto wanted was to be acknowledged, to be useful, to be someone that people looked up to...and not just literally either!

The night sluggishly passed and Naruto never really felt like he got much good sleep so it was with heavy lids that he opened his eyes and yawned, mouth stretching wide open, the area rumbling slightly from the intensity of his bodily action. A tiny voice suddenly piped up as Naruto finished, making him jump slightly. "Wooooah, that was cool!"

"Hngh? What? Who said that?" Naruto questioned, head turning side to side, propping himself up slightly on his elbows.

"Hey, hey, Boss! It was me! Down here!"

Naruto turned his attention down to his belly where a familiar face was grinning up at him, a large gap visible among the pearly whites. Naruto smiled back, recognizing his friend and "rival" Konohamaru immediately. "Hey Konohamaru! What are you doing here?"

"I wanted to see you! I heard you were back in the village from your mission and everyone was saying you got big but I didn't know you got THIS big! This is awesome!" Konohamaru said excitedly, clearly in awe of the two story tall fox ninja.

"Hehehehehe...yeah, it is, huh?" Naruto said, rubbing his finger under his nose. The chuckle made his stomach vibrate slightly, Konohamaru giggling as he moved from foot to foot. "How did you even get in here? Kakashi-sensei is supposed to be keeping a watch on this clearing."

Konohamaru winked and held his hands together. "Who do you think you're talking to?! I'm a world class ninja! I just sneaked by him without him even noticing!"

"Geez, I can't believe Kakashi-sensei is so bad at this!" Naruto pouted, outraged by his teacher's neglect. Of course, what neither boy knew was that Kakashi was quite aware of Konohamaru's presence...but with how down Naruto had looked before he fell asleep and how dingy his living quarters were at the moment, he figured Naruto could do with a friendly face. "Anyway, whatever, it's great to see you again! What have you been up to lately?"

And so Naruto listened as Konohamaru regaled him with tales of his exploits around the village, his time with Udon and Moegi, and his training. Naruto listened with a smile, nodding, laughing, and interjecting at various points with advice for the ninja in training. It was just like old times; it didn't matter to Konohamaru if Naruto was huge and if a little kid was fine with it, what excuse did anyone else have? It helped bolster Naruto's confidence once again that he was going to be fine no matter what happened and no matter how big he got.

The seal seemed to quiver slightly on his stomach, unnoticed by either Konohamaru or Naruto.

"So can you even feel me on here, Boss?" Konohamaru asked, getting to his feet and kicking his sandals off, letting his bare feet touch the warm, living ground that was Naruto's belly.

"Kinda...but you feel really light. Even Kakashi-sensei didn't feel very heavy. Heh, it was actually kind of funny, watching him stumble around. He tickled a little."

Konohamaru got a somewhat wicked grin on his face as he said, "Oh, you're ticklish huh? Like do you feel...this?"

He bent down and pressed his palms against Naruto's peach skin, his fingers wriggling against the flesh, the tips tickling trails across the plain. Naruto snorted, loud enough to scatter birds from the trees into the morning light, cawing and whistling in alarm, the snort pealing out into a cacophony of obnoxious, childish laughter, Naruto's hands immediately rising to try and stop Konohamaru but pausing, not wanting to hurt his little friend. "K-K-Konoha-ha-hahahahahahahahaha-hamaru! St-Stoooooop!"

Konohamaru giggled himself as he was knocked onto his back by the force of the undulations of Naruto's flat stomach, rolling backwards, then to the side, then forward again, his scarf trailing out behind him and getting tangled slightly among his arms and legs. Naruto quieted down slowly as Konohamaru braced himself, laying still, the ups and downs of Naruto's receding laughter making Konohamaru feel like he was on a boat. He flipped over onto his front and slowly crawled over to the central point of his seal and what was the most ticklish spot, Konohamaru figured, on his giant friend's belly: the navel. He stretched out his fingers and grinned at Naruto who was shaking his head, panting slightly. "Don't you dare!"

Konohamaru's fingers twitched, getting closer.

"I mean it Konohamaru!"

But it was in vain. Konohamaru viciously began to tickle around and within the small hole on Naruto's stomach, unleashing fresh waves of loud, boisterous laughter, Naruto's legs kicking up into the air and slamming back down to the forest floor, smashing deep footprints into the soft earth, again and again and again. The noise was shockingly loud, rattling the ears of anyone within a mile of the giant boy, the ground splitting and shaking underneath the power of his casual stomps. Konohamaru yelped as he was suddenly launched into the air by a particularly harsh burst of laughter, Naruto catching him lightly on his palm, lowering him back down to his chest. "Enough...enough...you got me...you win..."

"Woohoo!" Konohamaru shouted, throwing his arms into the air! "I did it! I beat the Giant Boss! What do I win?"

Before Naruto could answer, a loud cough was heard to the side of Naruto's body. Both boys looked down and saw Kakashi, with his arms folded, looking annoyed. Konohamaru shifted his eyes left and right, before throwing a smoke bomb down and stumbling away through the trees, his scarf almost getting tangled int he branches as he did so. Kakashi sighed as Naruto smiled sheepishly at him. "Sorry about that Kakashi-sensei..."

"It's fine, I'm sure you...needed that." Kakashi said, wondering, as he looked around at the devastation wrecked on the clearing just from Naruto's laughter induced squirming, if he had made a mistake in letting Konohamaru see Naruto. Then again...that infectious, sunny smile was on Naruto's face again so...Kakashi shook his head again and continued. "Well, how about we get you to your new living quarters then?"

"Ugh, good." Naruto said, wincing as his back popped as he sat up, grumbling. "Sleeping on the ground was not working for me."

"The Hokage managed to send out for some appropriately sized clothing and furniture for you but it's not like it's ideal." Kakashi warned. "This is all rather short notice and a bit too close to the Chunin Exams for much more to be done."

"I'll take what I can get." Naruto said, stretching, more pops and cracks coming from his body. He slowly got to his feet and put his hands on his hips, standing up on his tip toes, trying to see over the canopies of the trees...which he wasn't QUITE able to do...yet. "So where is this new warehouse...house supposed to be?"

"On the outskirts of the village." Kakashi called up. "It used to store raw materials for construction but hasn't been in use for a few years. We got lucky with that. Your clothes are waiting for you there as well."

"Hopefully it covers more than this..." Naruto said, tugging slightly at his threadbare coverings, almost pulling them apart by accident.

"It does...but not much more. Remember, it's short notice." Kakashi explained. "Anyway, that's all the information I have so why don't we go and see for ourselves?"

"Sounds good!" Naruto said, nodding and striding confidently back out of the clearing and towards the village.
111132122111122121.title: Friendly Face in the Dark

choices: Kakashi trusts that Naruto won't cause anything and leave him by himself.
Too Risky, Kakashi reassures Naruto that he will train them later.
1111321221111221211.content:
The walk to the new home for Naruto was a rather boring one compared to what he and Konohamaru was doing before but he guess that he don't want to make Kakashi-Sensei worry about his newfound strength and size even more, and besides its only the ground that got messed up was all, and maybe some stupid trees....

So thus he had to be careful since his sensei was leading him to the new home, so Naruto would have to now take short and small steps so as to not accidentally overtake him, though he did have to marvel at how big he was compared to him, while he was sure Kakashi-Sensei was a decently tall person, his whole barefoot was much bigger than he was, he's not quite sure he'd ever not look in awe at what a physical impossibility he is, but on another note he's freakishly strong and fast, if he really wanted to he could outrun Kakashi at his fastest and barely feel winded, though he would have to deal with the damage aftermath.

"So Kakashi-Sensei how far are we heading till we get to the Warehouse or whatever?" He asked curiously, he can't wait to get into a nice comfy bed, or something that wouldn't kill his back while he's sleeping, and clothes too, this big cloth just wasn't doing anything to protect his modesty, he'd like to move around and not randomly flash people and also not look like a cave boy.

"Its only a little bit more till then Naruto." Kakashi replied to his question, said giant in question groaned in slight irritation, "But its so boring and its not like I have much to do." He whined, all this walking and nothing was happening so far, just how much walking is it gonna take to get to this place?

His sensei sighed at his student's impatience, though he is rather fearful in that Naruto's hyper activeness would cause him to do something stupid but he guess he should have a bit more faith in him, after all he is showing some restraint and paying attention to his surroundings.

"Alright we're here." He said as the trees cleared away a bit before the two came across a large warehouse with a good patch of land nearby, good for Naruto if he wanted to train or get a little walking done, alongside a river that the boy can use for cleaning himself.

Naruto looked relieved and impressed at the sight, he didn't think they'd find a big enough warehouse that can hold him but here it is, "Man this place is kinda big." Naruto said looking at it as he stepped forward to get a closer look, the Warehouse doors was as tall as he was at his 20 ft tall and counting, kinda a hiatus on that last thing.

He walked over to the side of it as Kakashi stood a good distance away to see how Naruto feels about the new living arrangements, 'That Warehouse is about 45 feet tall, 150 ft long and 60 ft wide, it should be good enough to support him for a little while,' He thought to himself before he felt the ground shake as he looked back to see that Naruto came back, looming a bit over him with a happy grin on his face.

"So how is it?" He asked him as the giant chuckled a bit in joy, "It looks great, I didn't even think the place you said they prepared for me was this big, I think I can actually walk around inside, I'm gonna go see if the old man got me some good clothes, maybe they got some orange in them." He respond happily, Kakashi smiled from behind his mask, while it wasn't the best conditions, at least Naruto isn't taking this badly.

"We're going to bring more stuff as the week goes on to keep you well-fed and comfortable, so bare with the limited resources for now." He told him so that he wouldn't be surprised when he sees more workers bringing the necessities to living at the Warehouse.
